net.minecraft.src.forge

Interface IMinecartHandler


  • public interface IMinecartHandler

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void onMinecartEntityCollision(EntityMinecart minecart, Entity entity)
      This function allows several mods to add code into the collision routine at the same time regardless of the collision handler registered.
      boolean onMinecartInteract(EntityMinecart minecart, EntityPlayer player, boolean canceled)
      This function is called whenever a player attempts to interact with a minecart.
      void onMinecartUpdate(EntityMinecart minecart, int x, int y, int z)
      This functions is called at the end of every minecart's doUpdate loop.

    • Method Detail

      • onMinecartUpdate

        void onMinecartUpdate(EntityMinecart minecart,
                      int x,
                      int y,
                      int z)
        This functions is called at the end of every minecart's doUpdate loop. If you override EntityMinecart.doUpdate(), is recommended that you retain the code that calls this function.
        Parameters:
        cart - The cart that called the function.
        i - X coordinate of the rail
        j - Y coordinate of the rail
        k - Z coordinate of the rail

      • onMinecartEntityCollision

        void onMinecartEntityCollision(EntityMinecart minecart,
                               Entity entity)
        This function allows several mods to add code into the collision routine at the same time regardless of the collision handler registered. If you override EntityMinecart.applyEntityCollision(), is recommended that you retain the code that calls this function.
        Parameters:
        cart - The cart that called the function.
        other -

      • onMinecartInteract

        boolean onMinecartInteract(EntityMinecart minecart,
                           EntityPlayer player,
                           boolean canceled)
        This function is called whenever a player attempts to interact with a minecart. The primary reason for this hook is to fix a few bugs and put restrictions on how a minecart can be used under certain circumstances. If you override EntityMinecart.interact(), is recommended that you retain the code that calls this function.
        Parameters:
        cart - The cart that called the function.
        player - The player that tried to interact with the minecart.
        canceled - Wither or not a pervious hook has canceled the interaction of a player.
        Returns:
        Whether the player can interact with the minecart.
